meanings.sent1: After a long day of chores, the farmer felt toilworn and ready for bed.
meanings.sent2: The toilworn construction worker sat down to rest his weary muscles.
meanings.sent3: The toilworn chef collapsed into a chair after preparing a feast for the whole town.
meanings.sent4: Her toilworn hands told the story of a dedicated gardener who never gave up.
meanings.sent5: The toilworn soldier marched on, determined to complete the mission despite exhaustion.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of wear from labor.
meanings.sent1: The toilworn tools in the shed needed some repair after a season of hard work.
meanings.sent2: The toilworn path through the forest bore the marks of many travelers.
meanings.sent3: The toilworn fence around the farm had seen better days, but it still stood strong.
meanings.sent4: Her toilworn apron was a testament to the countless meals she had prepared with love.
meanings.sent5: The toilworn machinery in the factory creaked and groaned with each use.
